new feature development. And manual adherence to this rule leads to inconsistencies, exposes
security vulnerabilities, and complicates migrations when dealing with deprecated elements.
The choice to postpone maintenance tasks in favor of work that delivers more direct business
value is often made. This neglect leaves you at the mercy of third-party decisions, especially
during crucial migrations when supported versions are phased out.
What if we could automate the scout rule? What if we could do this not in one project at a time,
but over an entire organization's codebase?
We will explore how you can transform your inner scout into a true force of nature. You will learn
how to automate code maintenance to systematically enhance code quality and analyze the
impact of these actions. We will execute this strategy on real-world scenarios using open-source
repositories.

title: How to cut through the noise and look at the physics behind cloud sustainability.
abstract:
We'll look at the actual footprint of a GPU for a year with back of the envelope math, show how easy it is to break down the
 tools from the big 3 (AWS/Azure/GCP) in simple terms they tend to hide. And look at the three Rs (reduce, reuse, recycle), how they apply to cloud, and specifically to AI. 

In other words: Cloud & AI sustainability sans the bullshit.

title: A tale of Three Webs: The UX Journey from web 1.0 to web 3.0
abstract:
Welcome to ‘A Tale of Three Webs: The UX Journey from Web 1.0 to Web 3.0,’ a narrative voyage through the transformative world of the internet. Our story begins in the era of Web 1.0, a digital frontier of static pages and simple interfaces, where the web was a one-way street of information. As explorers in this nascent world, users were spectators, marveling at the possibilities of this new digital realm.
As we transition into Web 2.0 and now, the burgeoning Web 3.0, our tale evolves dramatically. Interactivity, collaboration, and personalization take center stage, redefining the user experience. From the interactive and social landscapes of Web 2.0 to the intelligent, decentralized vistas of Web 3.0, UX has been the compass guiding this journey. However, the UX of Web 3.0 also presents numerous challenges, which currently act as barriers to its broader adoption.
We embark on a thrilling journey to uncover the dynamic interplay between different eras and our relationship with technology. It’s a story of mutual influence - how technology continuously redefines our world, and in turn, how each era leaves its unique imprint on technological progress. Along the way, we’ll also venture into imaginative projections of what the future might hold in this ever-evolving narrative.

title: Super vision smart goggles: Observability !
abstract:
With Observability you attach little agents to each component that is involved in delivering the customer journey of your digital product. Components such as custom applications, containers, virtual machines, operating systems, network components, and many more.

Those agents collect information about the quality of the component based on customer behavior, such as clicking a JavaScript button or requesting information from an API. But also on interval by using a bot for executing these same requests from anywhere in the world.

 

Centrally gathering and automatically analyzing all this information gives you the opportunity to have the system alert the owner on deviations helped by big data analysis, such as anomaly detection or more complicated machine learning jobs.

Observability provides nice topology of your complete application landscape, it maps all dependencies and makes root cause analysis a piece of cake! But the real advantage of Observability is pro-active action: by automatically spotting smaller upfront indications of a possible degradation of the customer experience you can prevent that same degradation of the customer experience. An example of this is an anomaly in CPU usage of a database, which is correlated to the deviating latency of a request. Before the latency unacceptable an results in leaving customers the issue can be spotted, solved and thus prevented.

 

I show that conventional monitoring is evolving in a holistic and automated way which provides teams and decision makers with powerful pro insights based on historical facts about the customer journey, which are needed to prioritize quick action and make new plans for an unforeseeable future. Moreover by 2025 EU law (NIS2) requires official representatives of organizations such as KvK to have their monitoring situation in check by making them responsible for being able to finish a root cause analysis within 24h when dealing with a cyber security attack.

 

With this presentation you learn what the difference is between conventional monitoring and Observability. It explains the concept of Observability, how it is implemented, how it is used, what span of control it provides and how its insights enable them to grow in a healthy way.
